title: Thunderbird channels
content: I have been trying to stay on releases and was told to upgrade to 115.10.1. So I did that and was told to go to 115.18.0 and it was not noted as esr. So I did and was immediately told to go to 128.8.1 esr. I was not on the esr channel and do not want/need to be on esr. about:config has been changed to esr channel from release w/o my ok - the least I'd expect is a warning. Release 115.x.x has betas and releases more than I had seen previously - aboutr 25-26. It looks like nothing but betas from 116 to 128 and a lot of what look like releases from x.0 to x.10.2 which is new to me. What is the rational behind all these versions and why there is not a simple center of how to use this info? I remember when way back, tbird had issues but they were manageable.
creator: jeff-g

title: How to Repair SQL Backup Files?
content: If you want to repair SQL backup files, then you can try the Sysinfo SQL Backup Recovery Tool. In this, you recover all the corrupt backup files of the SQL server. It repairs damaged SQL backup files. This tool can extract MDF and NDF files from the corrupt BAK file. It recovers every database object like tables, views, triggers, procedures, columns, functions, and other items from the corrupt files. Additionally, it includes several features like it offers multiple modes of scanning, a preview option, and no file size restriction. It is compatible with all the versions of Windows OS.

title: Large message corrupted in Thunderbird after sending
content:
I sent a message with 2 large attachments, which came to about 700kb. I have my email account configured to move replies to the original message folder after sending. The sent message appears blank in the folder. View source reveals little but starts with the following: X-Mozilla-Status: 0001 X-Mozilla-Status2: 00000000 IesvbLYCv+2WRXVrCMCm89IOemygPZpNbz2NBY [and so on for 433 lines of 73 bytes], < 32kb.

When I use my online webmail interface, the message that Thunderbird can no longer read is intact, legible and contains both the large attachments. The same is true when viewed in another email client. I have restored the message by exporting it from the webmail and importing it back to Thunderbird (to keep my records intact), which Thunderbird handles okay.

The outgoing mail server log shows that the message received from Thunderbird and sent to the final recipient was the correct 700kb+ size.

I'm rather curious as to what went on there.

Attachments to post: 1. View of the corrupt message in the Trash folder 2. Intact message after importing as an export from webmail.
creator: marck1

title: "Dismiss all" button in Calendar Reminders window
content:
Is it possible to disable the "Dismiss All" button in the lower-right side of the Calendar Reminders window? I must have inadvertently clicked on that and my list of current (un-dismissed) reminders has completely disappeared. I am more of a line-by-line dismisser of reminders. If I accidentally dismiss one line, at least I can quickly write down what it was while it's fresh in my mind. Not so easy when my list of 10 or 15 reminders is gone in one single click.

Or, if the button can't be disabled, can the developers add an "Are you sure?" prompt to the "Dismiss All" sequence?

(I realize all those reminders can still be found by looking around in the main Calendar window, but that takes a lot of time to find the ones that should not yet be dismissed.)

Thanks!!

title: Autofile addon installation - cannot change support email for autofile addon
content:
Hello,

I am the developer of the autofile addon. I am trying to change the support email address for this addon. In the edit/manage page (https://addons.thunderbird.net/fr/developers/addon/autofile-fast-e-mail-to-folder/edit) I did successfully change the old support email address(autofile@oasisllc.com) to the new one (autofile@europhages.com) in the required fields. However the update does not happens in the module page and the email address remains the old one(autofile@oasisllc.com) when you try to send an email to support from the module page.

Actually the email remains stuck to the UUID in the module's manifest (autofile@oasisllc.com). It is like the support email remains stuck to the email in the module's manifest.

Btw, I am in France and I use the French version of the interface. Maybe this interface version needs be updated.

Thanks.

Henri

title: How to view only one message in preview pane
content:
Hello everyone

I recently upgraded from TB 69 to the latest TB (after a crucial add-on finally got updated), and I'm generally happy with it, except for one little irk:

In Classic layout, the preview pane now contain multiple messages. As far as I can tell, it contains all messages of the selected thread, in date order (not in message list order). I would prefer the preview pane to contain just ONE message, namely the currently selected message. It is annoying to have to click repeatedly inside the preview pane to access the individual messages in the preview pane. It is also visually confusing (to me).

What's worse, the messages in the preview pane do not follow the normal threading: they appear to be shown in order of date, not in the order of the messages in the message list.

In the screenshot, you can see the thread has 11 messages, and in the message list there are three subthreads. The preview pane also shows the 11 messages, but not in the same order as in the message list. Plus, in order for me to read any messages, I need to click inside the preview pane to fold each message in or out.

I prefer a situation where I can click a single message in the message list, and a single message is shown in the preview pane. Is this possible with the latest TB?

Thanks.
creator: ugcheleuce

title: Email received "Important Notice About Your Thunderbird Newsletter Subscription"
content: today I received an email from the thunderbird Newsletter team advising me of a data breach relating to MailChimp. It came on a unique disposable address only used for Thunderbird matters. Everything about it checks out as genuine and the various clickable links are the same as those I received on my original subscription email, but when I tried to use the "change my preferences" link (which again links to the genuine site, I got to a site which said it would send a verification email to my email address h t t p s:/ /thunderbird.us12.list-manage.com/profile/send-email (obfuscated for forum) . No such email arrives. There are NO ways I can see of contacting anyone on the newsletter team. I am trying to change the address used to send the newsletter to me, but am unable to do so as the verification email never arrives. Two questions - is this "important notice about your thunderbird newsletter subscription" genuine, and secondly - how do I update my preferences if I never get the verification email and can't otherwise contact the newsletter team? Thanks for any assistance, I can't see any other way of contacting the team.

title: Thunderbird indexing stuck - gmail
content:
Hello all:

For the last few months, I've been having some issues with frequent lockups while accounts update. I'm now having issues with indexing, and being able to search and find messages. According to the activity screen, indexing freezes around 97% on the Inbox of my main gmail account (~17,800 messages total in that inbox, indexing stops around 17,300 and hangs).

Version: 128.8.1esr OS: Windows 10 Accounts: 4 all IMAP (2 gmail) Largest inbox: about 17k messages

Troubleshooting done: 1. Repaired folders 2. Rebuilt global Index 3. Removed All mail from sync 4. Excluded antivirus (Windows Defender)

Is there any way to find the email is causing the lockup? Any other suggestions?
creator: afoltz26
